title: Selena Gomez Preaches Self Love on ‘Lose You To Love Me’
text:
Selena Gomez, in direct address to camera, tells us that she’s done with a toxic relationship in “Lose You To Love Me.” In her first single from her upcoming third album, Gomez talks about “rose colored glasses” and a partner who “got off on the hurting.” We can surmise that this was probably Justin Bieber, but the song, cowritten by Julia Michaels and Finneas O’Connell, among others, is appropriately vague with details. Gomez has had a difficult year, between a kidney transplant, mental health issues, and two breakups. In a comment pinned to the music video, Gomez wrote, “This song was inspired by many things that have happened in my life since releasing my last album. I want people to feel hope and to know you will come out the other side stronger and a better version of yourself.” Considering the single has already set the record for most pre-saves on Spotify ever, we’d say she’s off to a good start.

Related
description: The music video of Selena Gomez’s new single, Lose You To Love Me, premiered on Tuesday evening, featuring Selena’s first song from her third album.
